content: While he remains on the loose, the Machete Robber's reputation is as big as the efforts to stop him. Here's why that's tougher than it sounds and why it will happen. Maybe soon.
name: James Ford
title: As ‘Machete Robber’ strikes again, his reputation grows as fast as efforts to nab him

content: My wife and daughter were determined to bake an apple pie last night. This morning, here's how I get to benefit from the results! Yummmm.
name: James Ford
title: Timeline Photos

content: An arrest for a murder over a sex tape, thanks to Facebook and Instagram being used deftly by a private eye. EXCLUSIVE. Here's why the case is still open, and how you can help bring it to a close.
name: James Ford
title: Exclusive: Social media helps private eye catch NYC ‘sex tape revenge’ fugitive in Miami

content: If you thought the Electoral College vote was wrong, the Supreme Court of the United States is about to hear this case that you want to know about. That also goes for you if you thought the vote was right.
name: James Ford
title: ‘Pivotal Moment’ for Democrats? Gerrymandering Heads to Supreme Court

content:
If you ever had a crush on a teacher and thought, "What if..." France's new presidential front-runner is for you. Wow. 
Big shoutout to my good friend Martha Schulman for bringing this to my attention.
name: James Ford
title: France may be about to have its most unusual First Lady ever

content: *SO* proud to join Mario Diaz Pix 11 and Jay Dow in winning two(!) RTNDA Edward R. Murrow Awards for our Jack Johnson series. A big thank you to PIX 11 News for showing its support of our work by airing this excellent promotional spot. And big thanks to you for your support.
name: James Ford

content: New York City Fire Department (FDNY) Firefighter William Tolley's funeral. Mayor Bill de Blasio leads thousands of firefighters and police in the memorial service, beginning now. Livestream on PIX 11.com. Somber day. Rest in peace, sir.
name: James Ford

content: What a remarkable girl. It was a funeral for New York City Fire Department (FDNY) hero William Tolley,but the centerpoint of the ceremony was his 8 year-old daughter in a touching, unforgettable way. As the dad of an only daughter myself, the whole thing was particularly moving. Rest in peace, knowing your child carries on your legacy.
name: James Ford
title: Firefighter Tolley laid to rest, but his daughter, 8, is focus of memorable funeral ceremony

content: Big thanks to James from Queens for stopping by our PIX 11 live truck today. James and James!  Thanks for watching!

content:
It's National Press Freedom Day. And Reporters Without Borders ranks the U.S.
higher for press freedom now than in recent years. Still, we're not in the top ranks of democracies. Here's why.
name: James Ford
title: On World Press Freedom Day, student shares her opinion on why a free press matters

content: So does the punishment fit?  Principal bans parents from their kids' school as a battle to unseat her rages on.
name: James Ford
title: East Harlem principal bans parents from her school in latest chapter of protests against her

content: Should it be illegal for a prospective employer to ask you your past salary? That will be the law in New York City, starting later today. Details on PIX 11 News starting at 5.
name: James Ford

content: NYC employers will no longer be able to ask prospective employees their salary history with this bill signing, now, by Mayor Bill de Blasio
name: James Ford

content: NYC now becomes one of the few places where a prospective employer can't ask you what your previous salary was. Here's why some employers are skeptical, and why advocates say that's a good thing.
name: James Ford
title: Employers in NY can no longer ask for salary history, in move to bridge gender wage gap

content: Excited to be riding in Bike New York's TD Five Boro Bike Tour this weekend #TDFBBT! Big thanks to Kirstin Cole for picking up my and my daughter's credentials! For the record, Kirstin rides the 40 miles in 2 hours. I take quiiiiiite a bit longer.
name: James Ford

content: After a boycott, kids should return to class at this elementary school today, but will Mayor Bill de Blasio finally respond to parents' calls for the principal to resign? Parents have set up a website http://www.savecpe1.org, held petition drives, phone campaigns, letter writing blitzes. What does it take?
name: James Ford
title: Parents pull kids from Harlem school in one-day protest of principal they say is destroying it

content: Great guy, bad crime, of which he was a victim. The surveillance video shows the intensity, but it also clearly shows the crooks.  Here's to the NYPD finding them and arresting them soon.

content: Two days, two bodies found in Central Park waterways. The NYPD says they don't suspect criminality and the two are unrelated. What do you say?

content: "It's a [male genitalia]," a motorist says an NYPD officer scrawled on his traffic ticket. Now, the cop's copy of the ticket has disappeared. In a PIX 11 News exclusive, here's why the motorist says he was unfairly targeted and why there's now an internal investigation.
name: James Ford
title: Exclusive: Alleged offensive scrawl on a traffic ticket leads to NYPD internal investigation

content: Bowling with my BRO -- Kevin!  And check me out -- three spares and a strike! This simply doesn't usually happen, frankly. But I'll take it.
name: James Ford
title: Timeline Photos

content: Then, next game, 2 strikes and a spare! It's been a looong time since I've bowled, but worth the wait!
name: James Ford
title: Timeline Photos

content: Sorry to keep at this, but Game 3 -- starts with a strike(!), then a spare and two more strikes?!?!?  Insane!!!!
name: James Ford
title: Timeline Photos

content: I swear this is the last time -- 3 strikes and 3 spares?!?!? This is not my life!
name: James Ford
title: Timeline Photos

content: Proud to be invited to The Innocence Project gala. That's Meryl Streep hosting. PIX 11's senior producer Rebecca Millman and I were invited because of our New York Emmy Awards-nominated story with the organization. They do great, important work.

content: Esperanza Spaulding has now taken the stage at the Innocence Project gala #IPGala2017. Singing of freedom for the wrongfully convicted. What a night!
name: James Ford

content: Joan Baez has taken the stage at the Innocence Project Gala #IPGala2017, singing "Prison Trilogy."
name: James Ford

content: Innocence Project founders Barry Scheck and Peter Neufeld speak on the 25th anniversary of the organization that has helped more than 350 innocenct people get free from prison, including dozens from death row.

content: Mayor Bill de Blasio says Queens Boulevard is no longer The Boulevard of Death. "It's The Boulevard of Life," he says, touting significant drops in fatalities on the roadway.  But what about the city's other streets and avenues?

content: Loving this post from Jill Nicolini The Great! Can't wait to see her in the morning!

content: A third consecutive day of 90-degree temps are on tap for Friday. Officially, that's a heatwave. Is spring actually going to arrive? Sometime? Shout out to my buddy, meteorologist Michael Schlacter, for the heatwave reminder.
name: James Ford
title: Record breaking temperatures hit the city for a 2nd consecutive day
